required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiac Safety and Efficacy for Early-stage Breast Cancer Patients Treated With Pegylated Liposomal Doxorubicin（PLD)
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiac Safety and Efficacy for Early-stage Breast Cancer Patients Treated With Pegylated Liposomal Doxorubicin（PLD）：an Dynamic Randomized, Positive Control, Open, Multicenter Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, multicenter, open, controlled Post-Marketing Study. 272 early stage female breast cancer patients who were histopathology confirmed with adjuvant chemotherapy indications were enrolled in this study .The subjects will be randomly assigned to one of the two treatment groups at a 1: 1 ratio, and stratified by trastuzumab,age,baseline cardiac risk factors.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects will receive one of two treatment regimens:
Group A: intravenous infusion of pegylated liposomal doxorubicin（PLD） 35 mg/m2, d1; cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m2, intravenous infusion, d1; once every 21days, for 4 cycles. Sequential docetaxel 100 mg/m2, intravenous infusion, d1, or paclitaxel 80mg/m2,intravenous infusion, d1,8,15, once every 21 days, for 4 cycles.
Group B: intravenous infusion of doxorubicin 60 mg/m2, d1; cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m2, intravenous infusion, d1; sequential docetaxel 100 mg/m2, intravenous infusion, d1, or paclitaxel 80mg/m2,intravenous infusion, d1,8,15, once every 21days, for 4 cycles. The primary endpoint is cardiotoxity,the secondary endpoint is 5-year disease-free survival (DFS), 5-year overall survival (OS), and safety: hematology and non hematological toxicity.

primary_outcome.description: Congestive heart failure with clinical symptoms, or no symptoms but an abnormal LVEF

secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and Severity of adverse events according to the CTC AE V4.03

arm_group.arm_group_label: PLD plus CTX sequential docetaxel or PTX
arm_group.description: pegylated liposomal doxorubicin 35 mg/m2,i.v.,d1, plus cyclophosphamide（CTX） 600 mg/m2,i.v.,d1, sequential docetaxel 100 mg/m2,i.v.,d1, or paclitaxel（PTX） 80mg/m2,i.v.,d1,8,15, once every 21days, for 4 cycles.

arm_group.arm_group_label: DOX plus CTX sequential docetaxel or PTX
arm_group.description: doxorubicin（DOX） 60 mg/m2,i.v.,d1, plus cyclophosphamide 600 mg/m2,i.v.,d1, sequential docetaxel 100 mg/m2,i.v.,d1, or paclitaxel 80mg/m2,i.v.,d1,8,15, once every 21days, for 4 cycles.

intervention.description: pegylated liposomal doxorubicin is 35 mg/m2 intravenously on Days 1 of each 21-day cycle followed by cyclophosphamide.
intervention.arm_group_label: PLD plus CTX sequential docetaxel or PTX

intervention.description: cyclophosphamide is 600 mg/m2 intravenously on Days 1 of each 21-day cycle, followed by docetaxel or paclitaxel.
intervention.arm_group_label: DOX plus CTX sequential docetaxel or PTX
PLD plus CTX sequential docetaxel or PTX

intervention.description: docetaxel is 100 mg/m2 intravenously on Days 1 of each 21-day cycle.
intervention.arm_group_label: DOX plus CTX sequential docetaxel or PTX
PLD plus CTX sequential docetaxel or PTX

intervention.description: paclitaxel is 80mg/m2 intravenously on Days 1, 8 and 15 of each 21-day cycle.
